meanings.definition: A railroad car with a flat platform and no sides or roof, used for transporting heavy or bulky items.
meanings.sent1: The workers loaded the heavy machinery onto the flatcar.
meanings.sent2: The flatcar carried the construction materials to the site.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken try to drive the flatcar? To transport eggs, of course!
meanings.sent4: The flatcar was a sturdy ship sailing through a sea of steel rails.
meanings.sent5: The image of the flatcar against the sunset was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To transport something on a flatcar.
meanings.sent1: They flatcarred the logs to the sawmill for processing.
meanings.sent2: He flatcarred the crates of fruits to the market for sale.
meanings.sent3: The idea to flatcar the piano to the concert seemed crazy but worked perfectly.
meanings.sent4: She flatcarred her emotions, carrying them carefully to avoid spilling.
meanings.sent5: The decision to flatcar the fragile glassware was risky but necessary for the move.
